Description: Small bronze male figure on a small plinth in Egyptian dress and pose, probably a votary; the man is standing with arms by his sides and left foot slightly forward; he wears a kilt with a central panel and a conical helmet with a small knob on top resembling the white crown of Upper Egypt; the figure and plinth are cast together in lost-wax technique.
Curator's comments: See also Masson, 'Kypriaka VII: Le sanctuaire d'Apollon à Idalion (Fouilles 1868-1869)', BCH 92 (1968), pp. 386-402, esp. 394(f) & fig. 19.
Bibliographic references: Reyes 1992 / The anthropomorphic statuettes of archaic Idalion (cat. no. 1, p. 245 & pl. 15a)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Robert Hamilton Lang
